statements: UPDATE TicketSales SET ticket_price = 75.00 WHERE event_name = 'Concert'
UPDATE TicketSales SET seat_section = 'VIP' WHERE event_name = 'Theater Play'
UPDATE TicketSales SET seat_section = 'General' WHERE event_name = 'Sports Event'
UPDATE TicketSales SET ticket_price = 50.00 WHERE event_name = 'Concert' AND seat_section = 'VIP'
UPDATE TicketSales SET event_date = '2022-12-31' WHERE event_name = 'Sports Match' AND seat_number BETWEEN 1 AND 100
UPDATE TicketSales SET seat_section = 'General Admission', ticket_price = 30.00 WHERE ticket_id = 5
UPDATE EventTickets SET ticket_price = 50 WHERE ticket_id = 1;
UPDATE SeatingArrangements SET seat_section = 'VIP' WHERE seat_id = 3;
UPDATE EventTickets SET event_name = 'Music Concert' WHERE ticket_id = 2;
UPDATE EventTickets SET ticket_price = ticket_price * 1.1 WHERE ticket_price > 100
UPDATE EventTickets SET seat_number = (SELECT seat_number FROM SeatingArrangements WHERE seat_id = 1) WHERE ticket_id = 1
UPDATE SeatingArrangements SET seat_status = 'Booked' WHERE seat_number IN (SELECT seat_number FROM EventTickets WHERE ticket_id = 2)
UPDATE event SET event_name = 'New Event Name' WHERE event_id = 1;
UPDATE ticket SET price = 29.99 WHERE ticket_id = 1;
UPDATE customer SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE customer_id = 1;

UPDATE customers SET phone_number = '+1-555-123-4567' WHERE customer_id = 7890;
UPDATE tickets SET ticket_price = ticket_price * 1.1 WHERE ticket_price < 100
